language.content:
The Goals of the Project ************************
Define a Standard Protocol ==========================
There is no industry standard middleware protocol. A standard protocol is necessary for interoperability and competition between vendors' implementations.
Build a Reference Server ========================
A reference server implementation is the only way to verify that the standard wire-level protocol is well-formed and feasible to implement.
Build a Set of Client APIs ==========================
Creating a set of client APIs saves developers the cost of learning the wire-level protocol. There exist industry-standard APIs, such as JMS, which we (will) conform to.
Create an Open Source Project =============================
OpenAMQ is designed as an open source project that will promote the AMQP wire-level protocol and the AMQ standard architecture.
The AMQP Wire-Level Protocol ****************************
AMQP has these features:
- High-level: implements a set of generic primitives that can be easily mapped to standard message-oriented middleware use cases. - Modern: uses channel multiplexing, security negotiation, MIME typing, and many other 'best of breed' techniques. - Efficient: uses fast binary data structures. - Pervasive: portable to any operating system with network I/O. - Standard: will be proposed as an IETF standard.
More information: [/protocol.html:The AMQP protocol]
The Reference Server ********************
The OpenAMQ server has these features:
- Small, fast, efficient single-process server - A complete implementation of AMQP - Portable to Linux, Solaris, Unix, Win32 - Built in ANSI C, using iMatix technology
More information: [/server.html:The OpenAMQ server]
The Client APIs ***************
The OpenAMQ client APIs have these features:
- Providing a JMS-like interface, with extensions - Implemented in Java, C, COM - Planned implementations: Perl, C++
More information: [/clients.html:The OpenAMQ clients]
The Open Source Project ***********************
The OpenAMQ open source project is still under construction.
